広葉樹再生林を対象とした林分成長モデルFSDのパラメータの決定手法(共著)
Reconstructing Past Stand Structure using Tree Ring Data(共著)
paper_title.en: Reconstructing Past Stand Structures using Tree Ring Data

description.ja: We developed a method to reconstruct past stand structures especially diameter distribution, by data obtained by investigations of present stands. On the assumption that regeneration takes place in gaps when upper-story trees die, we reconstructed past upper-story trees in past gaps. Past gaps were estimated from tree ring analysis and spatial distribution analysis of present trees. Past lower-story trees were reconstructed according to shading of the forest floor. It became possible to reconstruct past diameter distributions by repeating this procedure. We applied this method to a broad-leaved secondary forest stand in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan, and obtained apparently satisfactory results in reconstruction.
description.en: We developed a method to reconstruct past stand structures especially diameter distribution, by data obtained by investigations of present stands. On the assumption that regeneration takes place in gaps when upper-story trees die, we reconstructed past upper-story trees in past gaps. Past gaps were estimated from tree ring analysis and spatial distribution analysis of present trees. Past lower-story trees were reconstructed according to shading of the forest floor. It became possible to reconstruct past diameter distributions by repeating this procedure. We applied this method to a broad-leaved secondary forest stand in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan, and obtained apparently satisfactory results in reconstruction.

paper_title.ja: Reconstructing Past Stand Structures using Tree Ring Data
paper_title.en: Reconstructing Past Stand Structure using Tree Ring Data(共著)

description.ja: We developed a method to reconstruct past stand structures especially diameter distribution, by data obtained by investigations of present stands. On the assumption that regeneration takes place in gaps when upper-story trees die, we reconstructed past upper-story trees in past gaps. Past gaps were estimated from tree ring analysis and spatial distribution analysis of present trees. Past lower-story trees were reconstructed according to shading of the forest floor. It became possible to reconstruct past diameter distributions by repeating this procedure. We applied this method to a broad-leaved secondary forest stand in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan, and obtained apparently satisfactory results in reconstruction.
description.en: We developed a method to reconstruct past stand structures especially diameter distribution, by data obtained by investigations of present stands. On the assumption that regeneration takes place in gaps when upper-story trees die, we reconstructed past upper-story trees in past gaps. Past gaps were estimated from tree ring analysis and spatial distribution analysis of present trees. Past lower-story trees were reconstructed according to shading of the forest floor. It became possible to reconstruct past diameter distributions by repeating this procedure. We applied this method to a broad-leaved secondary forest stand in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan, and obtained apparently satisfactory results in reconstruction.

paper_title.ja: 天然林施業計画作成手法のシステム化(II)伐採経路ネットワーク図を利用した伐区・伐採順序の決定手法(共著)
天然林施業計画作成手法のシステム化(I)林型区分と林分成長シミュレーションによる択伐率の決定(共著)
paper_title.en: Construction of systematic planning method on natural forest management (I) : Determination of a cutting ratio based on a forest classification and stand growth predictions

description.ja: 天然林施業を行うためには森林の持つさまざまな機能を保ちながら適切な保続収穫を得られる施業計画を作成することが必要である。しかし、大面積の天然林における択伐施業を対象に信頼度の高い施業計画を作成することは難しい。そこで、本研究では、容易かつ信頼性の高い天然林施業計画作成手法の開発を目標とする。本報告では、林型区分と林分成長シミュレーションモデルを利用して計画対象林分の適切な択伐率を決定し、収穫量を予測する手法について検討した。実行例として東京大学北海道演習林内の天然林の一部を対象に択伐率の決定を行った結果、将来の林分構造の変化を予測した択伐率を決定することができた。今後、林型区分へのリモートセンシング技術の導入やより精度の高い林分成長モデルの開発を進めることにより、さらに的確な択伐率の決定と収穫量の予測を行うことが可能になると考えられる。
description.en: In natural forest management it is important to make management plans which allow for maximum sustained yield while at the same time preserving the original characteristics of the forest. However, it is difficult to develop such a plan designed for use with a selective cutting system in large-scale natural forests. The purpose of this study was to develop a management planning method for use in natural forests which is both safe and easy to use. In this paper, we propose a method for the determination of a cutting ratio based on a forest classification and stand growth predictions. For example, we determined the cutting ratio for a part of the Tokyo University Forest in Hokkaido. Then we made selection cutting ratios based on predictions of the transformations of stand structures. It is hoped that, with the incorporation of remote sensing technology and the development of several stand growth models, we will be able to make the method more useful.
